meanings.definition: A French soldier, especially one from World War I
meanings.sent1: During World War I, the poilu showed great courage on the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: The poilu fought bravely for France during the war.
meanings.sent3: The poilu joked with his comrades to keep their spirits high.
meanings.sent4: The poilu was a symbol of resilience and patriotism.
meanings.sent5: The image of the poilu in his uniform is iconic in French history.

meanings.sent1: The cute puppy was so poilu that everyone wanted to pet him.
meanings.sent2: The bear looked majestic with its long, poilu coat.
meanings.sent3: The room was so poilu with dust that it needed a good cleaning.
meanings.sent4: The forest was a poilu blanket of green and brown.
meanings.sent5: The cozy blanket felt soft and poilu against her skin.
